title: Blinking block cursor can obscure inline breakpoint

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81175

1. Set cursor to blink and cursor style to block
2. Start debugging
3. On a line with inline breakpoints, place cursor directly before an inline breakpoint indicator

![blinkingBlockCursor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3672607/66003048-e9f6d200-e459-11e9-80fb-19e831473866.gif)

title: [A11y] Screenreader reads unrelated text before toast notification/alert contents
body:
Environment Details:
Application Name: Visual Studio Code
Application Version: 1.38.1 (user setup)
Commit: b37e54
Electron: 4.2.10
Node.js: 10.11.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

Repro steps:
1. Go to Extensions
2. Pick any ol' extension (confirmed on Java Extension Pack)
3. Launch screen reader, like [NVDA](https://www.nvaccess.org/download/)
3. Use keyboard to select "Install" button
4. Hit <Enter> on keyboard

Expectation:
Toast content are read by the screen reader, as they're the most pertinent to the user's next action.

Reality:
Lots of intermediate text is read first, finally getting to the toast that's been waiting.  Should have higher aria priority.

title: [A11y] Keyboard focus is not automatically moved to toast notification
body:
Environment Details:
Application Name: Visual Studio Code
Application Version: 1.38.1 (user setup)
Commit: b37e54
Electron: 4.2.10
Node.js: 10.11.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

Repro steps:
1. Go to Extensions
2. Pick any ol' extension (confirmed on Java Extension Pack)
3. Use keyboard to select "Install" button
4. Hit <Enter> on keyboard

Expectation:
Keyboard focus is moved to the resulting toast, allowing me to dismiss or take action.

Reality:
Keyboard focus stays in the main editor window, where it was before.  Difficult or impossible to tab to the resulting toast.

title: Default discretion does not work as expected for image editors
body:
#81698

`"discretion": "default"` in package.json, I expect this new extension to replace the built-in image preview but it doesn't seem to work, instead I get the option like when I leave discretion out:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/65986169-33362a00-e438-11e9-9c7c-0f80226b991f.png)

If both are marked as default the non-built-in extension should win.

title: [json] allow sub schemas in schema associations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a ["definitions"](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/structuring.html) member for a JSON schema, and put a subschema there. 2. Attempt to refer to this subschema in `settings.json`. *** I'm in a folder called "json" with a subfolder called "schemas" with the schemas, and a subfolder called ".vscode" for the `settings.json`. Here is the definitions schema I am using: ``` { "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2019-09/schema", "type": "object", "definitions": { "items": { "type": "array", "items": { "$ref": "items.json#" }, "minItems": 1 } } } ``` If I just make `items.json` into an array and use `"url": "./schemas/items.json"` works fine, but that isn't very conducive to my current work case.   So I tried using this: ``` "schema": { "type": "array", "items": { "$ref": "./schemas/items.json" } } ``` Got this error: "Problems loading reference 'vscode://schemas/custom/schemas/items.json': Request vscode/content failed with message: cannot open vscode://schemas/custom/schemas/items.json. Detail: resource is not available".   Tried using this: `"url": "file:///C:/Users/BLATANT-DOXX-RISK/Source/Repos/json/schemas/types.json#/definitions/items"` And it just used `types.json`, ignored the definitions part, and looked for nothing but a blank object.   Finally, I tried using this: `"url": "./schemas/types.json#/definitions/items"`. Got this error: "File not found (c:\Users\BLATANT-DOXX-RISK\Source\Repos\json\schemas\types.json#\definitions\items))".   @aeschli came up a *lot* when looking through Github issues. *** VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700HQ CPU @ 2.60GHz (8 x 2592)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled

title: vscode.tasks.taskExecutions not cleaned up when a no-command task is terminated
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1903

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Prepare the following tasks. `parent` has no command, only depends on `echo`.
```
    "tasks": [
        {
            "label": "echo",
            "type": "shell",
            "command": "echo Hello"
        },
        {
            "label": "parent",
            "dependsOn": ["echo"]
        }
    ]
```
2. Use `vscode.tasks.fetchTasks()` to get tasks then execute `parent`. `vscode.tasks.taskExecutions` now contains 2 instances, one for `echo`, one for `parent`.
3. Once `echo` is completed (`parent` should be completed too since there is nothing left to do), check `vscode.tasks.taskExecutions`.

**Expected**:
`vscode.tasks.taskExecutions` should be empty.

**Actual**:
`vscode.tasks.taskExecutions` still contains an instance for `parent`.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

body:
#81698

Windows

1. Open an image with built-in image preview
2. Click in the image to focus/zoom
3. ctrl+k, the chord status bar item appears as expected
4. ctrl+t, the chord status bar item disappears and the non-chord ctrl+t keybinding executes

title: Windows key `code` down not find VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Version: 1.38.1 (user setup)
Commit: b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0
Date: 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z
Electron: 4.2.10
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VS code and DO NOT say add a desktop item
2. After install, hit the windows key and type `code`. Notice that VS code is not an option
3. re run the install and check the add desktop item option
4. After done, retry step 2 and notice VS code is found
5. Delete the desktop shortcut
6 Repeat step 2 and VS Code is NOT found

Note that the Windows key workflow works for all my other apps (e.g., slack, ...) and there are no desktop items on my fresh Windows 10 machine.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

title: Gracefully handle build errors for preLaunchTask
body: Testing #81637 I tested this on the [vscode-pullrequest-github](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github) repo with some older npm modules (it had been a while sine I last synced). When I attempted to launch the extension + default build task (via prelaunch task) I was hit with a build error: So I stopped the debug session and also killed the terminal process, but then the debug session continued: I think that if you launch the default build task via a launch config and you have build errors, the launch task should stop. I would also love it if in this situation when you stop the debug session that it also stops the build process as you likely need to investigate the errors.

title: Context key button doesn't work in explorer with native title bar

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
native title bars on windows, in the following state:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/65979069-8d7bbe80-e429-11e9-894b-95af00681320.png)

Pressing the context key button will focus the outer explorer:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/65979110-9bc9da80-e429-11e9-91c9-394e422a3760.png)

Pressing again will open the context menu for the outer explorer, not the item I focused.

title: Webview editor open with dialog will flash when no activation event is present
body:
#81698

SSH: Windows -> Ubuntu

Opening a file that has a custom webview contributed will flash the open with dialog. Below is using ctrl+shift+t to reopen last closed editor.

![popup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/65978112-f4987380-e427-11e9-9a3c-b6eaa2b1eeff.gif)

Adding a onWebviewEditor activation event fixed the problem.

title: Expect functions ordered top down in call hierarchy viewer
body: Issue Type: Feature Request Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81658 When invoking the call hierachy viewer I would expect to see the methods ordered by their top down order in the function. I was a bit surprised for example to see that shortcut appears before intermediate1 in the screenshot below. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1704059/65970337-40660f80-e45e-11e9-9a2a-c7d03b98ac6c.png) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.39.0-insider (313ede61cbad8f9dc748907b3384e059ddddb79a, 2019-10-01T07:29:05.652Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

title: Delay Javascript/Typescript lint
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

When I type code, I don't need a bunch of squiggly lines to pop up to tell me that "namesp", "namespa" and "namespac" are not a thing. I'd like to delay the lint until the time a file is saved.

Unfortunately the list of settings is bloated and unorganized, I'm not sure how I'm supposed to find that functionality in there or if it even exists.

title: SCM: Adding to .gitignore should put folder if folder is selected

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Testing: #81233

When right clicking on a folder in the SCM view and picking "Add to .gitignore" I think I would expect that folder to be added to the `.gitignore` file. Currently each file that is modified in that folder is being added.

title: Active inline breakpoint isn't highlighted
body:
re #81175

* set breakpoints as show in this file https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-references-view/blob/a48315c11bfeec50fc0d018f555097f61c888ce4/src/extension.ts#L26
* hide the references viewlet
* the 'editorHighlight.hide()' inline breakpoint is active 
* :bug: the inline breakpoint doesn't get the highlight (yellow arrow enclosing dot), instead the gutter breakpoints is highlighted, step in, step out and the yellow arrow does appear inline. 

![Oct-01-2019 11-21-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1794099/65950318-1b61a480-e43e-11e9-8145-3980a758ac9a.gif)

title: Inline breakpoints flicker and jump
body:
re #81175

* have inline breakpoints
* click one, click it again and again
* :bug: everything is super nervous, instead of enabling/disabling breakpoints seem to disappear/reappear with the consequence of text being shifted around (related to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81715)

![Oct-01-2019 11-10-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1794099/65949264-26b3d080-e43c-11e9-9b43-e2fa4e3fe05c.gif)

Tree sample has outdated vscode.proposed.d.ts file. For example it declares a message inside TreeView.

title: File Explorer shows up two time in extension sample
body: Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81635 See attached screen shot. Not sure if this is wanted.
